reviews.text: Best sushi in Louisville! The fish is incredibly fresh. Happy hour specials are a great value. The atmosphere is trendy and upbeat.
reviews.author: Stephanie K.

reviews.text: Really good seafood for being landlocked. The oysters were fresh and the selection was impressive. Service was attentive. Prices are fair.
reviews.author: Marcus W.

reviews.text: The spicy tuna roll is perfection. Great cocktails and the bourbon selection lives up to the name. Always a fun night out here.
reviews.author: Nicole R.

reviews.text: Good but not great. Sushi was fine, nothing exceptional. Music was way too loud. Had trouble hearing our conversation.
reviews.author: Patricia M.

reviews.text: Love this place! The poke bowl is my go-to. Fresh ingredients, great portions, reasonable prices. The vibe is casual and fun.
reviews.author: Brandon H.

reviews.text: Solid sushi spot. The chef's special rolls are creative and delicious. Happy hour is packed so arrive early. Service can be slow when busy.
reviews.author: Elizabeth P.

reviews.text: Fantastic seafood tower! Perfect for sharing. The crab legs were sweet and meaty. Great for a special occasion. Will definitely return.
reviews.author: Andrew D.

reviews.text: Overpriced and underwhelming. Sushi rolls fell apart. Service was inattentive. Expected much more based on the reputation.
reviews.author: Carol J.

reviews.text: Best place for sushi and drinks in the Highlands. The rainbow roll is beautiful and delicious. Staff is knowledgeable about the fish.
reviews.author: Derek F.

reviews.text: Good sushi with a fun atmosphere. The edamame is perfectly seasoned. Sake selection is extensive. Can get crowded and noisy on weekends.
reviews.author: Melissa G.

reviews.text: Outstanding from start to finish. The tuna tartare is fresh and flavorful. Bourbon cocktails are expertly crafted. A Louisville gem.
reviews.author: Jonathan C.

reviews.text: Very good sushi for the Midwest. The spicy salmon roll has the perfect amount of heat. Prices are reasonable for the quality.
reviews.author: Karen L.

reviews.text: Decent sushi but nothing special. The atmosphere is nice but the noise level is too high. Service was friendly but forgetful.
reviews.author: Ronald T.

reviews.text: My favorite sushi spot in town. The fish is always fresh, the rice is perfectly seasoned. The bartenders make excellent cocktails.
reviews.author: Tiffany B.

reviews.text: Great happy hour deals. The volcano roll is delicious and huge. Service is usually quick. Good for a casual dinner or drinks with friends.
reviews.author: Christopher N.

reviews.text: Consistently excellent sushi and service. The presentation is beautiful. Love the trendy but welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Vanessa S.

reviews.text: Good food and fun vibe. The seaweed salad is fresh and tangy. Bar area can get crowded. Make a reservation for dinner.
reviews.author: Matthew V.

reviews.text: The best seafood restaurant in Louisville. Everything we tried was excellent. The staff is friendly and the space is beautifully designed.
reviews.author: Samantha D.

reviews.text: Fine for what it is. Sushi was okay, nothing memorable. Drinks were good. Probably wouldn't make a special trip but fine for the neighborhood.
reviews.author: Daniel M.

reviews.text: Amazing food, great service, fun atmosphere. The lobster roll is decadent. Bourbon flights are a must-try. One of our favorites in Louisville.
reviews.author: Ashley and Ryan K.
